profile.name: Andrés
profile.title: Seasoned Java Pro | Turning Ideas into Robust Backend Magic
profile.description:
Senior Backend Developer with 13+ years of experience building scalable, maintainable systems using Java and Spring Boot. Specialised in clean architecture, including hexagonal design and event-driven systems with Kafka. Strong advocate for testable, resilient code and well-structured engineering practices.

Experienced in both product-led startups and enterprise projects across the UK and Spain, with a track record of delivering reliable APIs, mentoring teammates, and driving architecture decisions.

Passionate about continuous learning, async-friendly collaboration, and contributing to remote-first international teams that value autonomy, clarity, and craftsmanship.

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription:
My ideal job is one where I can focus on building robust, scalable backend systems while collaborating with a team that values clarity, ownership, and engineering excellence. I enjoy refining designs, discussing architectural decisions, and making code better — not just functional, but elegant.

I thrive in international, remote-first teams with well-structured processes and purposeful communication. I appreciate when stand-ups stay focused, decisions are data-driven, and developers have a real voice in shaping the product.

While I have no issue mentoring or leading when needed, my core passion lies in hands-on coding and problem solving. I find joy in turning complex requirements into clean solutions, especially in event-driven and microservice-based architectures.

I also believe in continuous learning — whether it’s through courses, certifications, or just exploring new tools and paradigms. The right environment for me is one where growth is not just encouraged, but expected.
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices:
I care a lot about writing clean, understandable code. 

I usually apply design patterns when they make sense, and I’m a big fan of hexagonal architecture since it helps keep things tidy and easy to test. I enjoy designing microservices that talk to each other through events, and I write integration tests that catch issues before they reach production.

I’m also someone who likes to bring technical ideas to the table. Finding simple, solid solutions is one of the things I enjoy most about backend work.
